newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to meet some Paris Club members in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Russia to meet some Paris Club members in Sept.

text.p: Russia said on Friday it will start meeting members of the Paris Club of government creditors individually in early September to negotiate rescheduling debts to them following April's framework agreement.
The Paris Club agreed to reschedule $40 billion of Russian debt, for up to 25 years, including a grace period of six years.

A Russian team will meet Swiss officials in the first week of September to agree the exact amount of debt to be rescheduled and the schedule of payments, Alexei Smirnov, head of foreign credit department at the finance ministry, told Reuters.
The following week officials will meet the German government, Russia's biggest creditor, he said.
Russia has already received draft agreements from Germany and Switzerland, Smirnov said.
Altogether deals must be signed with 18 countries.
